content.text:
I'll help you get familiar with the codebase structure and current state. Let me start by exploring the repository to understand what we're working with.

< Glob pattern="**/*" />
< Glob pattern="src/**/*" />

Let me get a better overview of the project structure and recent changes:

< Bash command="find /Users/juliani/repos/svelte5/wiki/src -type f -name '*.svelte' | head -20" />
< Bash command="ls -la /Users/juliani/repos/svelte5/wiki" />

Based on the git status, I can see we're working on a Svelte 5 wiki application with recent changes to shell components and sidebar functionality. The repository appears to be a SvelteKit app with a focus on document/wiki features.

Let me check the main structure:

< Read file="/Users/juliani/repos/svelte5/wiki/package.json" />
< Read file="/Users/juliani/repos/svelte5/wiki/src/app.html" />

The project is using Svelte 5 (as indicated by the repo name) with recent work on shell components, page trees, and sidebar functionality. There are some new files related to page tree item menus and sidebar state management that were recently added.

Would you like me to dive deeper into any specific component or functionality?
